greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer partitions of n whose augmented differences are distinct.
comment: The augmented differences aug(y) of an integer partition y of length k are given by aug(y)_i = y_i - y_{i + 1} + 1 if i < k and aug(y)_k = y_k. For example, aug(6,5,5,3,3,3) = (2,1,3,1,1,3).
The Heinz numbers of these partitions are given by A325366.
link: Fausto A. C. Cariboni, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..440
example: The a(1) = 1 through a(11) = 10 partitions (A = 10, B = 11):
For example, (4,4,3) has augmented differences (1,2,3), which are distinct, so (4,4,3) is counted under a(11).
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 23 2019
